channel.title: share linux connection via usb to a rooted android device (reverse tethering)
channel.description: as the title suggests, it is possible to share the whonix connection via usb to a rooted android device, can you help me?

item.title: share linux connection via usb to a rooted android device (reverse tethering)
item.dc:creator: Patrick
item.description:
6363:

it is possible to share the whonix connection via usb to a rooted android device,

Is this question similar to https://www.whonix.org/wiki/Dev/Torified_Wi-Fi_Hotspot?

Do you intent to route the traffic originating from an Android device to be torified through Whonix-Gateway? Then some things from above link apply.

Undocumented.

Whonix – 18 Apr 21

Unsupported

This feature is either undocumented, untested, or unsupported. Options: Become a Contributor / Apply Free Support Principle / Purchase Professional Support.

Read full topic
item.source: share linux connection via usb to a rooted android device (reverse tethering)

item.title: share linux connection via usb to a rooted android device (reverse tethering)
item.dc:creator: HulaHoop
item.description:
This is Linux so almost anything is possible. Look at this guide for reverse tethering. I am not responsible for the software they mention.

Linux Windows and android Tutorials – 2 Aug 18

Reverse Tether from Linux to Android - Linux Windows and android Tutorials

Tether is a useful option in lots of scenario. What about the reverse tether? It's also possible on Linux with the help of Gnirehtet. Learn more.

Est. reading time: 3 minutes

As for data passing from an Android device via VM USB, this is another separate thing. YMMV depending on the hypervisor.

There’s no security gain from such a complex setup. An easier way is to have a second wifiusb card act as a hotspot on the PC while the primary one is connected to the internet and route your Orbot enabled device thru that.

Read full topic
